text:
The mail task's mailport attribute seems to be ignored.
Port 25 is always used even if mailport is specified.
creator: joeyavis@yahoo.com

text: which mailer are you using?  JavaMail, plain?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
joeyavis@yahoo.com
text:
Plain. No Javamail. No external jars.
I tested with both JDK 1.3 and 1.4 with the same result.
I used this build.xml file:

<project default="all" basedir=".">
  <target name="all">
    <mail
        from="me"
        tolist="you"
        mailhost="127.0.0.1"
        mailport="2025"
        subject="Hello"
        files="build.xml"
    />
  </target>
</project>

I ran a proxy at port 25 and 2025 to confirm this.
It never connects to port 2025 - only 25.
Very simple to reproduce.

Created attachment 2085
Specifies the non standard port BEFORE connecting to it.
